Author: Martin Reindl
Review: Quiet and surprisingly empty. I was one of three people at the temple when I went around 3 PM. The temple itself is nothing great, but the atmosphere is good, so if you're at Ginkaku-ji walk ten minutes and drop by.

Author: Jeffrey Edison
Review: A quiet temple just off the Philosopher's Walk

Author: Joshua Tan
Review: It is not beautiful but the architecture and decor are different. Worth the see just for that.

Author: Joe Collver
Review: Great temple to visit along the Philosopher's walkway, especially during the autumn leaves season.

Author: Nathan Jirka
Review: Very picturesque and atmospheric temple, when the seasons change and even when he weather is bad. Just slightly off the beaten path which means dramatically less crowded than some of the main sights in Kyoto. Like many locations in Kyoto can be tough for those in a wheelchair or with limited mobility.

Author: Catherine Do
Review: Very nice place to visit if you are at the Path of Philosophy because it is very near.  I will always remember this place for the kindness of the priestess here who gave me an umbrella when it was raining and she saw that I did not have one.

Author: Ian Le
Review: Beautiful, quiet little temple in the woods. Near Ginkakuji, but doesn't draw many people, which is a big plus.

Author: Oswald M.
Review: Small but beautifull temple

Author: Cooper Carter
Review: I'm almost hesitant to review this one to keep it somewhat secret, as it was deserted when I went. No tourists, just serene beauty. Make the walk through the neighborhoods from larger, more famous sites to the North to take in this jewel of Kyoto.

Author: Jen Su
Review: This is the first temple I went to see in Kyoto. My favorite part was the sand/ zen garden added to the serene feeling of the temple. The path also allows you to walk around the garden. Beautiful temple.

Author: Xavier Mart√≠nez Palau
Review: One of the most beautiful temples.

Author: Dom L'eveille
Review: Great ambience, amazing gardens, no crowds.

Author: Brandon Smyth
Review: Small but quiet with a beautiful gate into a old garden with a pond and moss-covered masonry.

Author: Hin-Yan Liu
Review: Closed to the public when we visited. Maybe that's why it was so quiet

Author: Sylvester Pilgrim
Review: Very quiet, peaceful and tranquil. A great place to soak in the spiritual culture.

Author: Saele Beltrani
Review: Nice and quiet temple with a beautiful park around it

Author: Pieter Baeyaert
Review:
Went through this one on the way to the silver pavilion, there was a sign not to photograph the monkeys... Didn't spot any though.

Many more impressive temples and gardens in Kyoto, only recommended when enough time to kill in Kyoto.

Author: Scott Combs
Review: Nice quiet temple on the path of philosophy. It is away from everything which means no tourists crowded everywhere. Such a peaceful place. Very nice with all the nature surrounding it.

Author: Jack Poon
Review: I enjoyed this place. It‚Äôs quiet, it‚Äôs free, and there are plenty of photo opportunities. Definitely drop by.

Author: Johanna Tan
Review: Nice little temple, very quiet and serene

Author: Tng Chee Hiong
Review: A smaller temple and is less crowded.

Author: C F
Review: It's a small down to earth temple, very lovely.

Author: Laura Marinescu
Review: Less touristic, truly zen:)

Author: Kasai M
Review: A serene, hidden treasure. This place offers lectures by the head priest as well as various art events.

Author: Bruno Schwizer
Review: Not very busy at all and quite nice but not a main attraction if limited on time.

Author: Jo√£o Paulo Moreira
Review: For those doing the Tetsugaku-no-Michi (Path of the Philosopher), it's a very rewarding detour!

Author: Stewart Went
Review: Not flashy or spectacular but very much away from the hordes and a peaceful detour from the main sites. In fact no-one there when we visited. Only needs 15 minutes and a slight detour off the Philosophers Path walk.

Author: Natalie Peraza
Review: I loved this temple! It was so beautiful, and serene.

Author: Lloyd Aran
Review: Despite Lonely Planet highlighting this place with their star, as a "hidden treasure of Kyoto", I found little to nothing interesting. There's just a very small though lovely garden. The rest is closed to the public. It might prove tricky to find due to the lack of English signs after some point. Unless you have some good-for-nothing spare time, it is not worth a deviation from the Philosopher's Path.

Author: Nadav Ben Yehuda
Review: It's simple and elegant, and sometimes there are art exhibits to see.

Author: Catcat chow
Review: Some demagogue after the typhoon

Author: Fernando Rosenberg
Review: When I visited this temple it appeared to be under construction or maintenance so there wasn't anything to see. On the bright side it was very peaceful and no entry fee was required.

Author: Jacob R
Review: Loved this park, I was the only person there when I went and it feels somewhah mystical.

Author: Nina K
Review: An amazing little secret spot in Kyoto. Nobody was there but us, and the place is so beautiful. It‚Äôs the perfect place to soak in the atmosphere of tranquility in Kyoto and to experience the beauty of nature in Japan.

Author: kiyoshi kawano
Review: HQ temple of Sodo-shu.

Author: Nadya Dee
Review: A quaint and quiet temple off the Philosophers Path.

Author: Charles Goulart
Review: I went to Honen-in early and it has peaceful gardens ,and was lucky to see inside the many small tearooms!!! Definitely worth a visit if you're in the Higashiyama area of Kyotoüòôüôè

Author: Simon Blackley
Review: Lovely garden, much quieter than some other sites. I saw a heron catch a fish.

Author: Simmi
Review: We went after hours about 5pm in the misty rain. It was absolutely beautiful without the hustle and bustle of crowds.

Author: Chris Sater
Review: Small, peaceful, and lovely.

Author: Sian Max
Review: My favorite temple. Do beautiful an rural. Good in any weather

Author: Philippe Weber
Review: Beautiful and calm temple in the woods

Author: Isabela Kubota
Review: If you're around stop by, but not a huge difference from other places. If you don't have a lot of time in town I think you can cross that from your list.

Author: Ray Chan
Review:
Staff really helpful.
We face downpour rain. They let us into the office and had some tea. They helped to call a cab, when the office was closed and they found out that we were still waiting for the cab, they chased after the taxi company, and wait until the taxi arrived.

Author: Shivani -
Review: Peaceful but nothing much there to see. Just nice enough to sit for a while.

Author: jared lee
Review:
Surprised to find very few tourists during the "peak" season at this Wonderful Honen-In Temple. A hidden gem!
The scene / facade at the front of temple itself, was like a beautiful picture, a portrait.
It's a small temple but yet, very serene, tranquil and it seems like, all is at peace with the soul. Very mystical indeed and definitely worth a visit!

Author: Ryan Calme
Review: Very peaceful, though smaller. That's probably a good thing, as there were no where near the crowds of nearby Ginkaku-ji (Silver temple)

Author: Ahmed Elbannan
Review: Very quiet and serene temple.

Author: Ruggero Marchesi
Review: Small and nice in a peaceful part of Kyoto. Closed to public.

Author: Carla Hyenne
Review: Beautiful secluded temple, really peaceful and almost empty of people

Author: Donal Burns
Review: Pleasant spot. Not crowded at all. Nice to relax at or pop into when visiting ginkakuji.

Author: Jeff Watson
Review: Superb temple in harmony w nature and away from the madding crowd

Author: kitz kirti
Review:
Peaceful temple...those who love to explore can visit this place ...a very nice place to see thess beauties....the culture the warmth of the temple....take positivity from here...
Amazing temple visit

Author: Raf
Review: Interesting with crystals in front of the main gate

Author: Â∞èÁªµÁªµ
Review: very secluded temple. there's also some interesting crystal-like pieces near the entrance of the temple, very pretty. the temple looks like it's becoming one with nature üòÇ it's very peaceful and worth a visit.

Author: Brandy Nicole Easter
Review: Beautiful temple. Very peaceful and lots of lush moss.

Author: Arttu V√§nninen
Review: Nature has really taken over this sanctuary area. Quiet and a place to relax after the heartbeat of the city.

Author: yuval feldman
Review: It‚Äôs nice nothing too special there

Author: H Kang
Review: such a beautiful, peaceful place.

Author: John Knox White
Review: Quiet and serene with unique gardens

Author: Corinna Zennig
Review: Very beautiful, free!, serene, and not that many people.

Author: Aloha nui mau loa
Review: Compact. Full of nature. Quiet above Kyoto's hustle.

Author: Basak Candemir
Review: Not very crowded, subtle and nice grounds

Author: Heleen Portheine
Review: It is a very pretty environment and they have regular exhibitions

Author: Vinayak Sharma
Review: Calm place, Free entry

Author: Chi Vo
Review: Beautiful spiritual and calming space

Author: Bartu NedTR
Review: Calm and serine temple. Met the priest and was amazed by his hospitality. As well as a koto performance held in the evening.

Author: JOHNNY LEE
Review: even great in late maple season

Author: Martin Korenek
Review: Beautiful temple and absolutely worth the walk. Feels ancient and yet well preserved. Plus you won't be finding any crowds with selfie sticks as a bonus.

Author: Siddharth Yadwad
Review: Beautiful but sorely underrated - do visit!

Author: Sylwia Galoch
Review: The interior is opened to visitors twice a year for a few days and it's one of the most beautiful places I know ‚ù§Ô∏è

Author: Onz Brau
Review: Just very over rated. There are much better 'hidden gems' in Kyoto

Author: gradhito
Review: This temple was pretty secluded. There were almost no one on my way there and in the temple itself. Only a few visitor and then none. Couldn't even find the temple keeper there. With monkeys and animals sound from the forest, the temple already blending with nature, I felt spooked for a bit. After a while then I was able to enjoy all of the nature and tranquility of the temple.

Author: Kieron Johnson
Review: A very tranquil alternative to the artistry at Ginkaku.

Author: Stephen Li
Review: beautiful and peaceful. A must visit in Kyoto

Author: Arati Chokshi
Review: Love it in all seasons.. beautiful place, usually not crowded

Author: Lionel Divry
Review: This small temple of the Jodo school, with its rustic thatched gate and raked sand mounds, is worth a visit.

Author: „Ç∏„Ç®„Éº„É†„Çπ
Review: One of our most favorite temples so we like to come often. It is best in the rain, as most wooded temples are. It is usually quiet and peaceful. The raked design on the mounds changes with the season.

Author: Natasja Lopez Mejia
Review: Nice quiet temple, away from the hustle and bustle.

Author: Rajeev Kapoor
Review: What a beautiful gem of a temple. So quiet and serene and peaceful. Very different from rest of the temples. Along the philosopher walk and is free entry. Probably the best kept secret and a very satisfying visit. Just so nice walking around the green gardens. Nature at its best!

Author: Scott Eaton
Review: This temple has a very picturesque gate and a small pond open to the public.  The building itself is not accessible to the public.

Author: Graphic
Review: Beautiful

Author: Possanunt Charoenkijkajorn
Review: Amazingly beautiful approach. The temple is calm and hidden gem.

Author: Josip Ivka
Review: Gorgeous temple grounds with many different beautiful locations for photo ops. It's close to the philosophers path so does well to combine the two. Highly recommended.

Author: Trevor Bentley
Review: Small shrine with immaculate moss covered grounds.

Author: Judy OBrien
Review: This is one of my favourite temples and is usually quiet. If you're in the area it's well worth a visit. The gate is really beautiful √†nd the temple itself is peaceful.

Author: taro ‚Äútaromoch‚Äù moch
Review: Beautiful, quiet

Author: Lisa Beth Klein
Review: Gorgeous with the fall colors. Peaceful

Author: Elizabeth Barlow
Review: Very beautiful temple just off the philosophers path. It's free to enter the grounds, the main building is not accessible to the public. It's very serene and peaceful. Doesn't seem to be overcrowded with tourists either, maybe a less well known temple. So beautiful

Author: Hugo Epstein
Review: cool temple

Author: cef d (Cef)
Review: Cute garden with some nice art

Author: Damien Shost
Review:
üìøüõê Stunning temple by the end of philosopher‚Äôs path. An incredibly beautiful hidden gem of the beaten path that it is absolutely worth a visit.

üå≥ In the nature and surrounded by nature. The moss is wonderful as they take good care of its grow during the year

‚úÖ Not crowded at all, so it is wonderful peace and quiet.

‚úÖ Fantastic views of Kyoto outskirts from its altitude

üÜìüí¥ Free

Author: Mari Fitzpatrick
Review: Beautiful, quiet temple away from the tourist crush. Not flashy or commercial but quietly gracious and contemplative.  There are sculptural works of art placed around the grounds, and they have art exhibitions, lectures etc. My favourite.

Author: Adrien D
Review: Nice atmosphere. Quiet place with a lot of trees.

Author: Cassandra Sim
Review: Not much to see when we arrived, paths were closed off to the public, and wasn't as 'serene' as described as others in the reviews. Perhaps this is no longer a secret spot.

Author: Sam Mackenzie
Review: Beautiful.

Author: Keith Dunn
Review: Such a nice place to visit during anytime of year.

Author: Adam Roach
Review: Greatest find in Kyoto. Although all of the temples in the area are great, H≈çnen-in was very peaceful compared to the other sites I visited.

Author: Max Pietsch (Max)
Review: Beautiful temple that was very peaceful and not busy when we arrived around 9am or so. Definitely worth a stop on the Philosopher's Path.

Author: Eugene M
Review: Compared to other local attractions this temple is rather small. However, size doesnt always matter. Its quiet, peaceful, and serene. Definitely worth visiting.
